frase: Lo difícil es que no entiendo la explicación del profesor.
sentence: The difficult thing is that I don't understand the teacher's explanation.

frase: Lo de ayer fue muy divertido, ¿vamos a hacerlo de nuevo?
sentence: What happened yesterday was very fun, should we do it again?

frase: Lo que digo es que deberíamos intentar algo diferente esta vez.
sentence: What I'm saying is that we should try something different this time.

frase: Lo tengo. ¿Me puedes decir qué es lo que necesitas que haga?
sentence: I have it. Can you tell me what you need me to do?

frase: Lo siento, no puedo hacerlo.
sentence: I'm sorry, I can't do it.

frase: Lo importante es que estés seguro de lo que quieres.
sentence: The important thing is that you're sure of what you want.

frase: Lo necesito para mañana por la mañana.
sentence: I need it for tomorrow morning.

frase: Lo primero que debes hacer es leer las instrucciones.
sentence: The first thing you should do is read the instructions.

frase: Lo hizo porque quería ayudar.
sentence: He did it because he wanted to help.

frase: Lo que dijo fue muy ofensivo.
sentence: What he said was very offensive.

frase: Me siento muy mal por lo que dije.
sentence: I feel very bad about what I said.

frase: Me encanta lo que has hecho con esta habitación.
sentence: I love what you've done with this room.

frase: No entiendo lo que está pasando.
sentence: I don't understand what's happening.

frase: No puedo creer lo que estoy viendo.
sentence: I can't believe what I'm seeing.

frase: No tengo miedo de lo que pueda pasar.
sentence: I'm not afraid of what might happen.

frase: Todavía estoy en shock de lo que pasó ayer.
sentence: I am still in shock about what happened yesterday.

frase: No estoy seguro de lo que quieres que haga.
sentence: I am not sure what you want me to do.

frase: Es lo que pienso, aunque no estoy seguro de si estoy en lo correcto.
sentence: It is what I think, although I am not sure if I am right.

frase: Es lo que siempre hago cuando tengo un problema, buscar la solución en internet.
sentence: It is what I always do when I have a problem, look for a solution on the internet.

frase: Es lo que dijo el profesor, aunque a mí me parece un poco dudoso.
sentence: It is what the teacher said, although it seems a little dubious to me.

frase: Es lo que me gustaría hacer, pero no tengo el dinero suficiente en este momento.
sentence: It is what I would like to do, but I don't have enough money at this time.

frase: Por lo que entiendo, la situación es muy complicada.
sentence: From what I understand, the situation is very complicated.

frase: Por lo que he oído, el restaurante es muy popular entre los turistas.
sentence: From what I've heard, the restaurant is very popular among tourists.

frase: Por lo que veo, necesitas ayuda con eso.
sentence: From what I see, you need help with that.

frase: Por lo que me dijeron, la reunión es a las 3 de la tarde.
sentence: From what I was told, the meeting is at 3pm.

frase: A lo largo de la semana, he estado trabajando en mi proyecto de investigación para el trabajo.
sentence: Throughout the week, I have been working on my research project for work.

frase: A lo largo de la costa, hay muchas playas hermosas donde puedes relajarte y disfrutar del sol.
sentence: Along the coast, there are many beautiful beaches where you can relax and enjoy the sun.

frase: Todo lo que necesitas hacer es seguir las instrucciones del libro para hacer el pastel.
sentence: All you need to do is follow the instructions in the book to make the cake.

frase: Todo lo que ella quiere es que la apoyes y la hagas sentir especial.
sentence: All she wants is for you to support her and make her feel special.

frase: Lo largo de mi carrera, he trabajado en varios proyectos interesantes.
sentence: Throughout my career, I have worked on several interesting projects.

frase: Lo largo de la historia de la humanidad, ha habido muchas guerras y conflictos.
sentence: Throughout the history of humankind, there have been many wars and conflicts.

frase: Por lo menos, podemos decir que intentamos hacer todo lo posible para resolver el problema.
sentence: At least, we can say that we tried to do everything possible to solve the problem.

frase: Por lo menos, tenemos suficiente comida para durar una semana más.
sentence: At least, we have enough food to last for one more week.

frase: En lo que respecta a mi trabajo, me esfuerzo al máximo para hacerlo lo mejor posible.
sentence: As far as my work is concerned, I strive to do it to the best of my ability.

frase: Lo que se dice en la noticia es muy preocupante.
sentence: What is said in the news is very concerning.

frase: Lo que se espera de ti en este trabajo es que seas puntual y trabajes duro.
sentence: What is expected of you in this job is that you be punctual and work hard.

frase: Con lo que he aprendido en este curso, creo que estoy listo para aplicarlo en mi trabajo.
sentence: With what I have learned in this course, I believe I am ready to apply it in my job.

frase: A lo que voy con esto es que necesitamos un plan de acción más detallado.
sentence: What I'm getting at is that we need a more detailed action plan.

frase: A lo que me refiero es que tenemos que considerar todas las opciones antes de tomar una decisión.
sentence: What I mean is that we have to consider all options before making a decision.

frase: A lo mejor deberíamos esperar a ver cómo se desarrolla la situación antes de tomar una decisión.
sentence: Maybe we should wait and see how the situation develops before making a decision.

frase: A lo mejor deberías pedirle a alguien más que te ayude con eso, parece demasiado complicado para ti solo.
sentence: Maybe you should ask someone else to help you with that, it seems too complicated for you alone.

frase: No hemos dormido bien en varias noches, por lo tanto estamos muy cansados.
sentence: We haven't slept well for several nights, therefore we are very tired.

frase: El edificio está muy viejo y necesita reparaciones urgentes, por lo tanto no es seguro vivir allí.
sentence: The building is very old and urgently needs repairs, therefore it is not safe to live there.

frase: Como te digo necesitamos hacer algo al respecto.
sentence: As I'm telling you we need to do something about it.

frase: Todo salió como tú querías.
sentence: Everything worked out the way you wanted.

frase: Te prepararé el bistec como tú prefieras.
sentence: I will make your steak however you like it.

frase: Te estuve esperando como una hora.
sentence: I waited for you for around an hour.

frase: La gasolinera está como a tres kilómetros de aquí.
sentence: The gas station is about three kilometers away.

frase: Ella es alta como su madre.
sentence: She is tall like her mother.

frase: Quiero ser como tú eres.
sentence: I want to be like you.

frase: Como llegues tarde al examen no se te dará más tiempo.
sentence: If you arrive late for the exam you will not be given extra time.

frase: Vive como un rey.
sentence: He lives like a king.

frase: Como estás tan ocupado no puedes ayudarme.
sentence: Since you're so busy you can't help me.

frase: Me gusta como te ves con ese vestido.
sentence: I like how you look in that dress.

frase: No me gusta como se comporta ella a veces.
sentence: I don't like how she behaves sometimes.

frase: No tengo ni idea de como lo hizo.
sentence: I have no idea how he did it.

frase: ¿Tienes alguna idea de como llegar allí?
sentence: Do you have any idea how to get there?

frase: Me quedan como mil pesos.
sentence: I have got about a thousand pesos left.

frase: Mi abuelo siempre nos cuenta historias de su juventud, como en el tiempo en el que trabajó como mecánico en un taller.
sentence: My grandfather always tells us stories from his youth, like the time he worked as a mechanic in a workshop.

frase: A veces sueño con tener una vida lujosa, como en el caso de una persona rica y famosa.
sentence: Sometimes I dream of having a luxurious life, like in the case of a rich and famous person.

frase: Me gusta el invierno porque puedo usar ropa abrigada, así como la chaqueta y los guantes que compré en esa tienda.
sentence: I like winter because I can wear warm clothes, like the jacket and gloves I bought at that store.

frase: La naturaleza es muy hermosa, así como la vista del atardecer desde lo alto de esa montaña.
sentence: Nature is very beautiful, like the view of the sunset from the top of that mountain.

frase: Estoy tan cansado que me siento como si fuera a dormirme de pie.
sentence: I am so tired that I feel like I am going to fall asleep standing up.

frase: Me encanta el olor de las rosas, como si fuera el aroma más dulce del mundo.
sentence: I love the smell of roses, as if it were the sweetest aroma in the world.

frase: Me encantaría tener un jardín como en la casa de mi abuela, con flores y plantas por todas partes.
sentence: I would love to have a garden like the one in my grandmother's house, with flowers and plants everywhere.

frase: Anhelo poder viajar a lugares exóticos como en la película que vi ayer.
sentence: I yearn to be able to travel to exotic places like in the movie I saw yesterday.

frase: Me encantaría tener un perro como el de mi vecino, que es muy dócil y juguetón.
sentence: I would love to have a dog like my neighbor's, who is very docile and playful.

frase: Este pastel es tan delicioso como el de la panadería que hay al final de la calle.
sentence: This cake is as delicious as the one from the bakery at the end of the street.

frase: Tuve que dejar mi trabajo como consecuencia de no poder compatibilizarlo con mis estudios.
sentence: I had to leave my job as a result of not being able to reconcile it with my studies.

frase: La familia tuvo que mudarse a otra ciudad como consecuencia de no poder pagar la hipoteca de la casa.
sentence: The family had to move to another city as a result of not being able to pay the mortgage on the house.

frase: Así como la lluvia es necesaria para el crecimiento de las plantas, la lectura es esencial para el desarrollo mental.
sentence: Just as rain is necessary for the growth of plants, reading is essential for mental development.

frase: El equipo de fútbol espera ganar el partido, así como la afición espera ver un buen espectáculo.
sentence: The soccer team hopes to win the game, just as the fans hope to see a good show.

frase: Estaba caminando por el bosque, como si fuera una aventura de exploración.
sentence: I was walking through the forest, as if it were an exploration adventure.

frase: Mi gato se comporta como si fuera el rey de la casa, siempre obtiene lo que quiere.
sentence: My cat behaves as if he were the king of the house, always getting what he wants.

frase: Estaba bailando como si se tratara de una competencia de baile.
sentence: I was dancing as if it were a dance competition.

frase: Me desperté temprano como si se tratara de un día normal, pero luego recordé que era mi día libre.
sentence: I woke up early as if it were a normal day, but then I remembered it was my day off.

frase: Es más guapo que su hermano.
sentence: He is more handsome than his brother.

sentence: I want the most expensive phone.

frase: Dos más dos igual a cuatro.
sentence: Two plus two equals four.

sentence: I need more time.

sentence: I want more help.

sentence: I have more work to do.

sentence: I want more information.

sentence: I have more things to do.

sentence: I want more options.

frase: Quiero ir al cine o a la playa.
sentence: I want to go to the movies or to the beach.

frase: Tienes que decidir si quieres ir al parque o al museo.
sentence: You have to decide whether you want to go to the park or to the museum.

frase: Puedes tener la pizza con pepperoni o sin pepperoni.
sentence: You can have the pizza with pepperoni or without pepperoni.

sentence: You have to choose between going to the gym or to the park.

sentence: Do you prefer going to the movies or watching a movie at home?

frase: Puedes ir en coche o en autobús.
sentence: You can go by car or by bus.

frase: Tienes que decidir si quieres ir al zoológico o al acuario.
sentence: You have to decide whether you want to go to the zoo or to the aquarium.

frase: ¿Prefieres ir a la piscina o a la playa?
sentence: Do you prefer going to the pool or to the beach?

frase: Puedes ir en avión o en tren.
sentence: You can go by plane or by train.

frase: Tienes que elegir entre ir al parque de atracciones o al parque acuático.
sentence: You have to choose between going to the amusement park or to the water park.

frase: ¿Prefieres ir al teatro o al concierto?
sentence: Do you prefer going to the theater or to the concert?

sentence: You can go by bike or on foot.

sentence: One or two?

frase: Me gusta pero es muy caro.
sentence: I like it but it is very expensive.

sentence: But, why do you have to leave?

frase: No puedo creer que hayas hecho eso, pero lo entiendo.
sentence: I can't believe you did that, but I understand.

frase: ¡Pero qué frío hace afuera!
sentence: But it's so cold outside!

frase: No puedo hacerlo solo, pero sé que lo lograré con tu ayuda.
sentence: I can't do it alone, but I know I'll succeed with your help.

frase: No me gusta la sopa de tomate, pero mi esposo la ama.
sentence: I don't like tomato soup, but my spouse loves it.

frase: Estoy cansado, pero sé que necesito seguir adelante.
sentence: I'm tired, but I know I need to keep going.

frase: No me gusta levantarme temprano, pero sé que es lo mejor para mí.
sentence: I don't like getting up early, but I know it's best for me.

frase: No estoy seguro de lo que quiero hacer con mi vida, pero sé que lo descubriré.
sentence: I'm not sure what I want to do with my life, but I know I'll figure it out.

frase: No sé cómo arreglar esto, pero estoy seguro de que podemos encontrar una solución juntos.
sentence: I don't know how to fix this, but I'm sure we can find a solution together.

frase: No me gusta volar, pero sé que es la forma más rápida de llegar a mi destino.
sentence: I don't like flying, but I know it's the fastest way to get to my destination.

frase: No estoy seguro de si estoy listo para tener hijos, pero sé que es algo a lo que quiero enfrentarme en el futuro.
sentence: I'm not sure if I'm ready to have children, but I know it's something I want to face in the future.

frase: No sé cómo cocinar, pero me gustaría aprender.
sentence: I don't know how to cook, but I'd like to learn.

frase: No sé nada sobre el tema, pero estoy dispuesto a aprender.
sentence: I don't know anything about the topic, but I'm willing to learn.

frase: No me gusta decir adiós, pero sé que es necesario para avanzar.
sentence: I don't like saying goodbye, but I know it's necessary to move on.

frase: Quería ir al cine, pero no se si voy a tener tiempo.
sentence: I wanted to go to the movies, but I don't know if I will have time.

frase: Me gustaría comprar esa camisa, pero no se si tengo suficiente dinero.
sentence: I would like to buy that shirt, but I don't know if I have enough money.

sentence: I would love to go to that concert, but I don't know if I can get tickets in time.

sentence: Oriol and Yolanda live in Paris with their two daughters.

sentence: The sightseeing of Dubrovnik and its monuments requires several days.

frase: Administrar y almacenar sus datos en la nube.
sentence: Manage and store your data in the cloud.

frase: Ella vive en el océano con muchos de sus amigos.
sentence: She lives in the ocean with many of her friends.

frase: ¿Por qué tienes tantas preguntas sobre sus planes?
sentence: Why do you have so many questions about their plans?

frase: Ella está muy enojada con sus amigos por haberle mentido.
sentence: She is very angry with her friends for lying to her.

frase: ¿Has visto sus fotografías de viajes? Son increíbles.
sentence: Have you seen their travel photos? They are amazing.

frase: Los profesores le pidieron a sus estudiantes que trajeran sus libros al siguiente día de clase.
sentence: The teachers asked their students to bring their books to the next class.

frase: Mi abuelo siempre habla de sus tiempos de juventud con tanto orgullo.
sentence: My grandfather always talks about his youth with so much pride.

frase: Ellos no me dijeron nada sobre sus planes para el fin de semana.
sentence: They didn't tell me anything about their plans for the weekend.

frase: ¿Te has fijado en sus nuevas zapatillas? Son muy caras.
sentence: Have you noticed their new shoes? They are very expensive.

frase: Sus sueños siempre son tan extraños y divertidos.
sentence: Their dreams are always so strange and funny.

frase: No estoy seguro de que esté de acuerdo con sus decisiones.
sentence: I'm not sure I agree with their decisions.

frase: ¿Por qué no le preguntas directamente a ella sobre sus planes?
sentence: Why don't you ask her directly about her plans?

frase: Sus ojos son del mismo color que el mar.
sentence: Their eyes are the same color as the sea.

frase: Uno de sus hobbies es hacer senderismo.
sentence: One of their hobbies is hiking.

frase: Uno de sus amigos es un famoso artista.
sentence: One of their friends is a famous artist.

frase: Uno de sus logros más importantes fue terminar sus estudios de posgrado.
sentence: One of their most important achievements was completing their graduate studies.

frase: Mi amigo es muy talentoso en el piano, y de sus habilidades de músico, la más impresionante es su soltura al improvisar.
sentence: My friend is very talented at the piano, and of his musical skills, the most impressive is his ease at improvising.

frase: La casa de mi abuela es muy vieja, y de sus habitaciones, la que más me gusta es la que da al jardín.
sentence: My grandmother's house is very old, and of its rooms, the one I like the most is the one that faces the garden.

frase: La ciudad en la que vivo tiene muchos parques, y de sus parques, el que más me gusta es el que está al lado del río.
sentence: The city where I live has many parks, and of its parks, the one I like the most is the one next to the river.

frase: Ella le vio en el casino esa noche.
sentence: She saw him at the casino that night.

frase: El banco le ha dado un dividendo de $100.
sentence: The bank has given you a dividend of $100.

frase: Manny tomó una foto pero se le perdió la cámara.
sentence: Manny took a photo but he lost the camera.

frase: Finalmente le añadimos el apio y ponemos sal al gusto.
sentence: Finally we add the celery and salt to taste.

frase: Sí pero eso no le da una licencia para robar.
sentence: Yes but that does not give her a license to steal.

sentence: I gave a gift to my friend for his birthday.

sentence: I lent my favorite book to my sister.

sentence: My grandmother made my brother his favorite meal.

frase: Mi padre le prestó su paraguas a mi tía cuando empezó a llover.
sentence: My father lent his umbrella to my aunt when it started raining.

frase: No sé que se le habrá pasado por la cabeza cuando tomó esa decisión.
sentence: I don't know what must have passed through his mind when he made that decision.

sentence: What can I offer the gentleman to drink?

sentence: It doesn't matter to me what he comes up with, I'm not changing my opinion.

frase: No entiendo por qué se le ocurrió hacer eso sin consultarme primero.
sentence: I don't understand why he thought of doing that without consulting me first.

sentence: What can I offer the lady to eat?

sentence: He cannot be allowed to continue behaving this way.

sentence: I don't understand what has happened to the car.

sentence: This tool will be useful for you in your work.

sentence: It will bring you a lot of joy to see your family after so much time.

sentence: I was so excited about the gift I had bought him that I couldn't wait to give it to him.

sentence: She has had ten years of experience in our industry.

sentence: I agree with what was discussed in the meeting.

sentence: That the window has been broken.

sentence: It has been a very hot day today.

sentence: Juan has finished his homework.

sentence: The company has announced a big expansion.

sentence: It has been raining all afternoon.

sentence: We have not been able to contact the responsible person.

sentence: No solution to the problem has been found.

sentence: He has become a leader in his field of work.

sentence: I like reading science fiction books.

sentence: I've been exercising to improve my health.

sentence: If I do it, will you help me?

sentence: If you're quick, you can still catch the train.

frase: No sé vivir sin ti.
sentence: I can not live without you.

frase: Sin ti, no sé cómo podría seguir adelante.
sentence: Without you, I don't know how I could go on.

frase: Sin estudiar, es imposible aprobar el examen.
sentence: Without studying, it is impossible to pass the exam.

frase: Sin luz, no podemos ver nada.
sentence: Without light, we can't see anything.

frase: Sin duda, es una de las mejores películas que he visto.
sentence: Without a doubt, it is one of the best movies I have ever seen.

frase: Sin embargo, todavía hay muchos desafíos por enfrentar.
sentence: However, there are still many challenges to be faced.

frase: Sin comer, no podemos sobrevivir mucho tiempo.
sentence: Without food, we can't survive for very long.

frase: Sin ellos, nunca hubiéramos logrado el éxito.
sentence: Without them, we would never have achieved success.

frase: Sin tu ayuda, no podría haber terminado el proyecto a tiempo.
sentence: Without your help, I couldn't have finished the project on time.

frase: ¡No pongas los pies sobre la mesa!
sentence: Do not put your feet on the table!

frase: La conferencia es sobre la tecnología.
sentence: The conference is about technology.

frase: Volamos sobre Cádiz.
sentence: We are flying over Cadiz.

frase: La cabaña se encuentra a 500 metros sobre el nivel del mar, ofreciendo una vista impresionante.
sentence: The cabin is located 500 meters above sea level, offering an impressive view.

frase: El éxito en el examen fue del tres sobre cien, lo cual fue un poco decepcionante.
sentence: Success on the exam was 3 out of 100, which was a bit disappointing.

frase: El partido comenzará sobre las seis, así que deberías llegar temprano.
sentence: The match will start around six, so you should arrive early.

frase: El uso de otros materiales es posible sobre acuerdos especiales.
sentence: The use of other materials is possible upon special agreements.

frase: El informe sobre las nuevas tendencias en tecnología ha sido publicado.
sentence: The report on new technology trends has been published.

frase: El libro sobre la historia de la humanidad es muy interesante.
sentence: The book on the history of humanity is very interesting.

frase: El artículo sobre el cambio climático es importante para leer.
sentence: The article on climate change is important to read.

frase: La charla sobre cómo mejorar la salud mental fue muy útil.
sentence: The talk on how to improve mental health was very useful.

frase: La mesa está sobre la alfombra.
sentence: The table is on the rug.

frase: Los estudiantes debatieron sobre el tema en clase.
sentence: The students debated the topic in class.

frase: El gobierno hizo un anuncio sobre la política económica.
sentence: The government made an announcement about economic policy.

frase: El paisaje es hermoso, sobre todo en el otoño.
sentence: The landscape is beautiful, especially in the fall.

frase: Es importante cuidar nuestra salud, sobre todo en tiempos de estrés.
sentence: It's important to take care of our health, especially during times of stress.

frase: Mi interés en este material es personal, no profesional.
sentence: My interest in this material is personal, not professional.

frase: Este es el libro que te dije.
sentence: This is the book I told you about.

frase: Este es mi número de teléfono si necesitas algo.
sentence: This is my phone number if you need anything.

frase: Este es el lugar donde crecí.
sentence: This is the place where I grew up.

frase: Este es el último día para entregar el trabajo.
sentence: This is the last day to turn in the work.

frase: Este es el momento que esperaba para hacerlo.
sentence: This is the moment I have been waiting for to do it.

frase: En este momento, no tengo tiempo para hablar contigo.
sentence: At the moment, I don't have time to talk to you.

frase: En este momento, estoy ocupado terminando un proyecto para el trabajo.
sentence: At the moment, I am busy finishing a project for work.

frase: Este tipo de comportamiento no es aceptable en nuestra empresa.
sentence: This type of behavior is not acceptable in our company.

frase: Este tipo de tecnología es muy avanzada y es difícil de entender.
sentence: This type of technology is very advanced and is difficult to understand.

frase: En este caso, creo que lo mejor sería seguir adelante con el plan original.
sentence: In this case, I believe the best course of action would be to move forward with the original plan.

frase: En este caso, no puedo ayudarte, pero te recomiendo que hables con alguien más.
sentence: In this case, I cannot help you, but I recommend that you talk to someone else.

frase: Ya ha olvidado lo que hiciste.
sentence: She has already forgotten what you did.

frase: ya sabes
sentence: you know

frase: Ya está disponible.
sentence: It is now available.

frase: Ya es tarde, deberíamos irnos a casa.
sentence: It's already late, we should go home.

frase: Ya he terminado el trabajo, lo entregaré mañana.
sentence: I have already finished the work, I will hand it in tomorrow.

frase: Ya no quiero hablar del tema, estoy cansado de discutirlo.
sentence: I don't want to talk about this topic anymore, I'm tired of discussing it.

frase: Ya he comido, gracias.
sentence: I've already eaten, thank you.

frase: Ya me he duchado, ¿y tú?
sentence: I've already showered, what about you?

frase: Ya conoces las respuestas, solo tienes que confiar en ti mismo.
sentence: You already know the answers, you just need to trust yourself.

frase: Ya casi llegamos a nuestro destino.
sentence: We are almost reaching our destination.

frase: Ya no tengo ese dinero, lo gasté en otra cosa.
sentence: I don't have that money anymore, I spent it on something else.

frase: Es una situación que ya no tiene solución.
sentence: It is a situation that no longer has a solution.

frase: Es un amigo que ya no veo con tanta frecuencia.
sentence: He is a friend that I no longer see as frequently.

frase: Es una relación que ya no funciona.
sentence: It is a relationship that no longer works.

frase: La torre de Illetes fue construida entre 1577 y 1597.
sentence: The tower of Illetes was built between 1577 and 1597.

frase: El parque es muy popular tanto entre turistas y ciudadanos.
sentence: The park is very popular both among tourists and citizens.

frase: ¿Qué ocurrirá cuando entre este código?
sentence: What happens when I enter this code?

frase: Entre tú y yo, creo que ella está equivocada.
sentence: Between you and me, I think she's wrong.

frase: Entre mis amigos, soy conocido por ser una persona divertida.
sentence: Among my friends, I'm known for being a fun person.

frase: Entre los idiomas que hablo están español e inglés.
sentence: Among the languages I speak are Spanish and English.

frase: Entre mis pasatiempos favoritos está viajar.
sentence: Among my hobbies is traveling.

frase: Entre el trabajo y la familia, me queda poco tiempo libre.
sentence: Between work and family, I have little free time.

frase: Entre mis metas a largo plazo está comprar una casa.
sentence: Among my long-term goals is buying a house.

frase: Entre las opciones que tienes, ¿cuál es tu preferida?
sentence: Among the options you have, which is your favorite?

frase: Entre las comidas del día, el almuerzo es mi favorita.
sentence: Among the meals of the day, lunch is my favorite.

frase: Entre los que estuvieron en la reunión, algunos estaban en desacuerdo con la propuesta.
sentence: Among those who were at the meeting, some disagreed with the proposal.

frase: Entre los que fueron elegidos para el equipo, yo soy el menos experimentado.
sentence: Among those who were chosen for the team, I am the least experienced.

frase: En primavera es cuando las flores florecen.
sentence: Spring is when the flowers bloom.

frase: Cuando era joven, soñaba con viajar por el mundo.
sentence: When I was young, I dreamed of traveling the world.

frase: Cuando termines el trabajo, podremos salir a celebrar.
sentence: When you finish the work, we can go out to celebrate.

frase: Cuando llegué a la fiesta, todos ya se habían ido.
sentence: When I arrived at the party, everyone had already left.

frase: Cuando me di cuenta de mi error, ya era demasiado tarde.
sentence: When I realized my mistake, it was already too late.

frase: Cuando esté listo, vuelve a llamarme.
sentence: When you're ready, call me back.

frase: Cuando estaba en el colegio, era muy tímido.
sentence: When I was in college, I was very shy.

frase: Cuando tenga tiempo, quiero leer ese libro.
sentence: When I have time, I want to read that book.

frase: Cuando vayas al supermercado, ¿puedes comprar leche?
sentence: When you go to the supermarket, can you buy milk?

frase: No todo lo que brilla es oro.
sentence: Not everything that shines is gold.

frase: No se puede tener todo en la vida.
sentence: You can't have everything in life.

frase: Hay algo en todo lo que hacemos.
sentence: There's something in everything we do.

frase: Todo es mejor en grande.
sentence: Everything is better in large.

frase: Es importante tener todo en su lugar.
sentence: It's important to have everything in place.

frase: Todo el esfuerzo vale la pena.
sentence: All effort is worth it.

frase: La paciencia es una virtud y todo llega a su tiempo.
sentence: Patience is a virtue and everything comes in its time.

frase: Todo es cuestión de equilibrio.
sentence: Everything is a matter of balance.

frase: No hay nada como una sonrisa en todo momento.
sentence: There's nothing like a smile in every moment.

frase: Todo el mundo tiene un papel en esta vida.
sentence: Everyone has a role in this life.

frase: No hay nada como el amor verdadero en todo momento.
sentence: There's nothing like true love in every moment.

frase: Todo es una cuestión de perspectiva y enfoque.
sentence: Everything is a matter of perspective and focus.

frase: Esta silla está rota.
sentence: This chair is broken.

frase: Esta es la oportunidad perfecta.
sentence: This is the perfect opportunity.

frase: Esta es la vida que escogí.
sentence: This is the life I chose.

frase: Esta es la decisión correcta.
sentence: This is the right decision.

frase: La clave para el éxito está en esta actitud.
sentence: The key to success is in this attitude.

frase: Esta es la razón por la que lo hice.
sentence: This is the reason I did it.

frase: No hay nada en esta tierra que me detenga.
sentence: There's nothing on this earth that stops me.

frase: Esta es la clave para un futuro brillante.
sentence: This is the key to a bright future.

frase: Esta situación no es tan mala como parece.
sentence: This situation is not as bad as it seems.

frase: No estoy seguro de qué hacer en esta situación.
sentence: I am not sure what to do in this situation.

frase: Hay una luz al final de esta oscuridad.
sentence: There's a light at the end of this darkness.

frase: No hay nada en esta vida que me asuste.
sentence: There's nothing in this life that scares me.

frase: Todos tenemos un propósito en esta vida.
sentence: We all have a purpose in this life.

frase: Este problema puede ser causado por una infección con bacterias.
sentence: This problem can be caused by an infection with bacteria.

frase: Ser fuerte es la clave del éxito.
sentence: Being strong is the key to success.

frase: Ser feliz es una elección.
sentence: Being happy is a choice.

frase: Ser amable es una virtud.
sentence: Being kind is a virtue.

frase: Ser paciente es la clave para el éxito.
sentence: Being patient is the key to success.

frase: No hay nada más importante que ser feliz.
sentence: There's nothing more important than being happy.

frase: No es fácil ser un líder.
sentence: It's not easy being a leader.

frase: Ser constante es la clave para alcanzar tus metas.
sentence: Being consistent is the key to achieving your goals.

frase: Ser positivo puede cambiar tu vida.
sentence: Being positive can change your life.

frase: Ser agradecido es importante en la vida.
sentence: Being grateful is important in life.

frase: No es fácil ser diferente.
sentence: It's not easy being different.

frase: Ser libre es un derecho fundamental.
sentence: Being free is a fundamental right.

frase: Son las cosas simples las que importan en la vida.
sentence: It's the simple things in life that matter.

frase: Son las personas que te rodean las que hacen la diferencia.
sentence: It's the people around you that make a difference.

frase: Son los pequeños detalles los que marcan la diferencia.
sentence: It's the little details that make a difference.

frase: Todos somos seres únicos y eso es lo que nos hace especiales.
sentence: We are all unique beings and that's what makes us special.

frase: Son las elecciones que tomamos las que definen nuestro futuro.
sentence: It's the choices we make that define our future.

frase: Los verdaderos amigos son aquellos que están ahí en las buenas y en las malas.
sentence: True friends are those who are there through thick and thin.

frase: Son las acciones las que hablan más alto que las palabras.
sentence: Actions speak louder than words.

frase: Las pequeñas cosas son las que hacen la vida más interesante.
sentence: It's the little things that make life more interesting.

frase: Son los sueños los que nos impulsan a seguir adelante.
sentence: Dreams are what keep us moving forward.

frase: Los momentos felices son aquellos que nunca se olvidan.
sentence: Happy moments are the ones that are never forgotten.

frase: Son las personas que te apoyan las que te hacen sentir más fuerte.
sentence: It's the people who support you that make you feel stronger.

frase: Los buenos recuerdos son aquellos que perduran para siempre.
sentence: Good memories are the ones that last forever.
